intro: Oligostemon schlimii, commonly known as the Schlim's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees, deriving some of its nutrients from the host. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its seeds are dispersed by birds, which consume the fleshy, orange berries. Oligostemon schlimii is often found in humid, tropical forests where it plays a role in the ecological interactions between plants and animals.
